result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah H. Felton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
in Wisconsin State Prison System consecutive to 14CF83.
Consecutive to: sentence imposed in Dodge County 14CF83.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs out of all inmate accounts at an amount of not less than $10.00 per month. To be paid through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample.

Day 2 - 8:42 (14CF83/230 and 15CF141/223)  Defendant, Jeremiah H. Felton, in court; in custody with Attorney William Mayer.  Attorney Kurt Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court heard on final copy of jury instructions/verdict forms. Off record 8:44.  Reconvene 9:00.  Jury in 9:00.  Court reviews jury instructions.  State gives closing arguments.  Atty Mayer gives closing arguments.  State gives rebuttal argument.  Court gives closing instructions.  Alternate juror picked.  9:49 Oath to Bailiffs given.  Jury out 9:50 to delibrate.  Court thanks alternate juror for service/excused.   Off record 9:52.  Reconvene 10:26.  Jury has  verdict 10:26.  Jury in 10:27.  Court reads verdicts:  14CF83 Guilty, 14CF230 Guilty, 15CF141 Guilty and 15CF223 Guilty.  Court polls jury.  Court thanks the jury for serving/excused 10:33.  State moves for judgment of guilty verdicts.  Defense agrees.  Court grants.  Discussion on sentencing.  Court schedules for sentence hearing.

12:50.  Case recalled.   Atty Klomberg moves Donald Thomas to be excluded from the sequestration order --granted.  Atty Mayer moves for mistrial. Off record.  Recalled 1:06, Court makes record of testimony in question. Argument by Atty Klomberg.  Argument by Atty Mayer.  Court denies motion for mistrial.  Jury in @ 1:14. (Exhibit 9 rec'd only for the purpose of the motion of the mistrial).  Jesse Harke c/s/t.  Cross by Atty Mayer. Wns excused.  Jill Sommers c/s/t.  Wns excused.  Donald Thomas c/s/t.  Cross by Atty Mayer.  Wns excused.  Dan Stiemsma c/s/t. Recess.  Jury out @ 1:53.  Jury in @ 2:04; recalled.  Recording played of interrogation of Deft. Tn'd direct by Atty Klomberg.  Cross by Atty Mayer.  Redirect by Atty Klomberg.  Recross by Atty Mayer.  Re-redirect by Atty Klomberg. State rests.  Jury out @ 2:29.  Recess.  Recalled 2:46.   Atty Klomberg heard.  Atty Mayer heard regarding Deft testifying.  Court questions Deft. Atty Mayer moves to dismiss.  Court denies motion.  Jury in @ 2:54.  Jeremiah Felton c/s/t.  Jury out @ 3:18.  Jury in @ 3:22.  Cross by Atty Klomberg.  Jury out @ 3:31.  Wns excused.  Jury in @ 3:34.  Defense rests.  Court admonishes Jury.  Jury excused @ 3:36  Recalled  3:48.  Informal jury instruction conference --off record.  Recalled @ 4:19.  Court makes recitation of off-record jury instruction conference.  Recess for the day @ 4:25.

(14CF83/230 and 15CF141/223) 8:44. Defendant, Jeremiah H. Felton, in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer. Attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussion w/regards to witnesses.  Recess.  Case recalled 9:04. Sequestration order in effect, with the exception of the two victims that will be witnesses.  Jury in @ 9:15.  Jurors called. Oath as to Qualifications.  Voir dire by the Court.  Voir dire by Atty Klomberg. Voir dire by Atty Mayer.  Jury called.  Oath as to Issues.  Jury excused @ 10:03.  Recalled 10:15.  Atty Klomberg requests Office Klemmer be excluded from the sequestration order  --granted. Discussions regarding prior convictions --6 for purposes of testifying. Motion hearing.  Atty Klomberg heard regarding Stipulation -as to exhibit #1; with regards to motion hearing regarding the 5/27/15 statement.  Argument by Atty Klomberg.  Argument by Atty Mayer.  Rebuttal by Atty Klomberg.  Rebuttal by Atty Mayer. Court finds it was a question and Deft had not been mirandized --may only be used if Mr. Felton testifies.  Jury in @ 10:49.  Court heard, preliminary instructions to Jury. Opening by the Atty Klomberg.  Opening by Atty Mayer.  Andrew Londos c/s/t.  Cross by Atty Mayer.  Redirect by Atty Klomberg.  Wns excused.  Trevor Klemmer c/s/t.  Cross by Atty Mayer.  Redirect by Atty Klomberg.  Recross by Atty Mayer.  Wns excused. Jury out @ 11:59.  Recess 12:00.

(14CF83 & 230 and 15CF141 & 223) Defendant Jeremiah H. Felton in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF230, 14CF83, 15CF141, 15CF223: Defendant Jeremiah H. Felton in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Mayer heard on status - unresolved at this point, schedule trial date(s); State has filed motion to join all 4 cases; State argument for joinder; Atty. Mayer heard - opposes all 4 cases being tried together; Court finds these 4 case are same/similar nature; will unduly prejudice the Def., Court finds not unduly prejudicial, Court will grant State's motion for joinder - all to be tried in Br. 2; 2 day trial needed; JT set; Def. heard - may want court trial; discussion held; bond cont.; Def. remanded

15CF141 (PH), 14CF83 (STC), 14CF230 (STC), 15CF223 (Initial): 2:02: Defendant Jeremiah H. Felton in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Will be waiver of PH on 15CF141, Initial to be done on 15CF223, Atty. Mayer notes that the Waiver is for both 15CF141 and new 15CF223; Initial done on 15CF223, complaint reviewed, rights reviewed; State heard on bond; Court orders $1,000 PA Bond: Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. PH waiver now done on 15CF141 & 15CF223, Court reviews right to PH; Def. waives PH; Court finds wavier made FK&V on 15CF141 and 15CF223; Informations filed, Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered;  Atty. Mayer heard - requests In Person Status set on all 4 cases and motions to be determined at STC date; IPSTC set 8/3/15 at 11:30am  In-Person Status Conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on June 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.

(14CF83 & 14CF230) Defendant Jeremiah H. Felton in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Comp eval is reviewed/discussed; defendant does not agree Dr's finding of competency; State moves Court to agree with Dr's report; Atty Mayer agrees; Court heard and will find def competent to proceed in both matter; Court holds initial appearance in 14CF230; Court questions defendant and reviews def's rights, chgs & pens; time limits are waived for prelim; Court orders $200 PA bond with no violent or abusive contact with anyone;
Competency hearing on December 8, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended
